meanings.definition: The quality or state of being mundane.
meanings.sent1: The mundanity of everyday life can sometimes feel overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: I prefer a bit of excitement in my day to break up the mundanity.
meanings.sent3: The mundanity of folding laundry is only made bearable by listening to music.
meanings.sent4: Her paintings transformed the mundanity of city streets into vibrant works of art.
meanings.sent5: The mundanity of the office was shattered by the sudden appearance of a clown.

meanings.definition: Something that is ordinary or commonplace.
meanings.sent1: The small town's mundanity was a comfort to its residents.
meanings.sent2: She longed for adventure in a world full of mundanity.
meanings.sent3: The mundanity of the situation was broken by a surprise visit from an old friend.
meanings.sent4: His poetry captured the beauty hidden within the mundanity of daily routines.
meanings.sent5: The mundanity of the menu was suddenly interrupted by the chef's special dish.
